sen.j: 一条忠貞（いちじょう たださだ、文久2年（1862年）5月 (旧暦) - ?）は江戸時代後期の公家。
sen.e: Tadasada ICHIJO (1862 - unknown) was a Kuge (court noble) who lived in the late Edo period.
Tadasada ICHIJO (May [the old calendar] [between May and June], 1862 - unknown) was a Kuge (court noble) who lived in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 5月 (旧暦)が訳抜けのため、追記しました。
sen.e: Tadasada ICHIJO (May [the old calendar] [between May and June], 1862 - unknown) was a Kuge (court noble) who lived in the late Edo period.
Tadasada was the third son of Tadaosa DAIGO.
He was the third son of Tadaosa DAIGO.
He was the third son of Tadaosa DAIGO.
Tadasada was adopted by Saneyoshi ICHIJO.
He was adopted by Saneyoshi ICHIJO.
He was adopted by Saneyoshi ICHIJO.

sen.j: 後継ぎとなった一条実輝も養子（四条隆謌の七男）。
sen.e: Tadasada's heir named Saneteru ICHIJO was an adopted son (the seventh son of Takauta SHIJO).
His heir named Saneteru ICHIJO was an adopted son (the seventh son of Takauta SHIJO).
His heir named Saneteru ICHIJO was an adopted son (the seventh son of Takauta SHIJO).
Tadasada had an official court rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
He had an official court rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
He had an official court rank of Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
The year of Tadasada's death is unknown.
The year of his death is unknown.
The year of his death is unknown.
